name: hashmark
description: Take contents of a file (or stdin), and output as new file with a hash in the name
author: Keith Cirkel (http://keithcirkel.co.uk)

scripts.semantic-release: semantic-release pre && npm publish && semantic-release post
scripts.test: for i in $(seq 1 21); do rm -rf testdir; npm run test$i; done
scripts.test9: echo Foo > test.js && ./bin/hashmark -d md5 -l 8 test.js 'test.{hash}' && rm test.js test.cbd8f798
scripts.test10: echo Test1 > test.js && echo Test2 > test2.js && ./bin/hashmark -d md5 -l 4 'test*.js' '{name}-{hash}{ext}' && rm test.js test2.js test-fa02.js test2-856b.js
scripts.test11: echo Test1 > test.js && echo Test2 > test2.js && ./bin/hashmark -l 4 'test*.js' '{name}-{hash}{ext}' -m testmap.json && rm test.js test2.js test-7e5e.js test2-1a65.js testmap.json
scripts.test13: echo abracadabra > test.js && ./bin/hashmark -d md5 -l 8 -r test.js '{name}-{hash}{ext}' && test ! -f test.js && rm test-97640ef5.js
scripts.test14: mkdir -p testdir/sub && echo Test1 > testdir/sub/test.js && echo Test2 > test2.js && ./bin/hashmark -d md5 -l 4 'testdir/**/*.js' 'test*.js' '{name}-{hash}{ext}' && rm testdir/sub/test.js test2.js test-fa02.js test2-856b.js && rmdir -p testdir/sub
scripts.test15: mkdir -p testdir/sub && echo Test1 > testdir/sub/test.js && echo Test2 > testdir/sub/test2.js && ./bin/hashmark -d md5 -l 4 --cwd 'testdir' 'sub/*.js' '{dir}/{name}-{hash}{ext}' && rm testdir/sub/test.js testdir/sub/test2.js testdir/sub/test-fa02.js testdir/sub/test2-856b.js && rmdir -p testdir/sub
scripts.test16: echo Foo > test.js && ./bin/hashmark -d md5 -l 8 test.js '{hash}-{base}' && rm test.js cbd8f798-test.js
scripts.test17: mkdir -p testdir/sub/nested && echo Test1 > testdir/sub/test.js && echo Test2 > testdir/sub/test2.js && ./bin/hashmark -d md5 -l 4 --cwd 'testdir' 'sub/*' '{dir}/{name}-{hash}{ext}' && rm testdir/sub/test.js testdir/sub/test2.js testdir/sub/test-fa02.js testdir/sub/test2-856b.js && rmdir -p testdir/sub/nested
scripts.test18: mkdir -p testdir/sub && echo 'Test --cwd without {dir} in pattern' > testdir/sub/test.js && echo Test2 > testdir/sub/test2.js && ./bin/hashmark -d md5 -l 4 --cwd 'testdir/sub' '*' '{name}-{hash}{ext}' && rm testdir/sub/test.js testdir/sub/test2.js testdir/sub/test-84c5.js testdir/sub/test2-856b.js && rmdir -p testdir/sub
scripts.test19:
mkdir -p testdir/sub && echo 'Test --cwd and --asset-map' > testdir/sub/test.js && ./bin/hashmark -l 4 --cwd 'testdir/sub' --asset-map assets.json '*' '{name}-{hash}{ext}' && (grep -e '"test\.js":\s*"test-7068.js"' testdir/sub/assets.json || (echo '
Wrong content in asset-map file' 1>&2; exit 1)) && rm testdir/sub/assets.json && rm -rf testdir
scripts.test20:
mkdir -p testdir/sub/subsub && echo 'Test --cwd and --asset-map with existing map' > testdir/sub/subsub/test.js && echo '{"existing": "some-file.js"}' > testdir/sub/assets.json && ./bin/hashmark -l 4 --cwd 'testdir/sub' --asset-map assets.json 'subsub/*' 'subsub/{name}-{hash}{ext}' && ((grep -e '"subsub/test\.js":\s*"subsub/test-f8fa.js"' testdir/sub/assets.json && grep -e '"existing":\s*"some-file\.js"' testdir/sub/assets.json) || (echo '
Wrong content in asset-map file' 1>&2; exit 1)) && rm testdir/sub/assets.json && rm -rf testdir
scripts.test21: echo 'Create and write file if the directory does not exist' | ./bin/hashmark 'newtestdir/newtestsubdir/test.{hash}.js' && rm -rf newtestdir
